page.title: 12Stagsden,Children
page.content: In 1983 there were 63 children between the ages of 1 month and 18 years.12 were under 5 and 5 of these attended a playgroup in Bedford.Of the 19 in the 5-9 age group, 15 attended the village school until it closed in July 1983. Now a bus takes them to Bromham.Of those aged 10-18, 75% go by bus to middle and upper school in Kempston and Wootton.The rest attend private schools in Bedford.In 1983 there were 6 full-time students(4 at University) The children say they like living in Stagsden although they have nowhere to play except the swings and must not play in the fields as the farmers tell them off-or on the bales as they might fall on you.They like to visit the Bird Gardens where local children are admitted free and would not like to see them close.
